intro: Scleranthus visianii, commonly known as the visianii sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, often succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, greenish or yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by small, dry fruits. Scleranthus visianii is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
